review.itemreviewed: XC902 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve put a few hundred miles on these shoes and the comfort is not as good as expected. I switched out the liners and that helped a little bit. My XC7s were more comfortable. I can’t imagine putting a long day in these shoes.
review.name: Not up to Expectations!

review.itemreviewed: XC902 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I usually wear mens shoes because womens bike shoes are never quite big enough. I wear an 11 (womens), and the Shimano 43 fits me great. I had the cheaper Shimanos for years, but with enough riding during the week, my feet really started to hurt. I had switched to some road shoes for awhile and really liked how much more comfortable they actually were. I also run some carbon inserts with my shoes, and figured I'd swap to a stiffer, more performant gravel/xc shoe. 

These are awesome. I love the boa dials, and they go both ways!! So if you want to tighten, and then loosen by one click, you can do that on the bike. It's pretty slick. The leather is soft as well, and so far I've found them to be capable in all conditions. I haven't done any serious hike-a-bikes in them, and I'm curious how the stiff sole will hold up with my foot trying to flex while hiking. 

But I've put a couple hundred miles on the shoes so far, and they're great. Very responsive and performant like my road shoes.
review.name: Excellent gravel/xc mtb shoes

name: XC902 S-PHYRE Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite mtb jersey for rides in temps from 40-20 Fahrenheit. It's warm but breathes well and the cut is perfect for me (5'9" 140 lbs) with a really well executed drop tail. It wears well on it's own, but I layer it with some combination of a base layer, a vest, and a wind jacket to handle a really wide range of temps. On weeknights, I'll ride after work, starting an hour or so before sunset, with temps in the 40s, but once the sun is gone, temps quickly drop 20+ degrees. I can start with just the fleece jersey, then add a vest, and I'm good to go down to a little below freezing. The weight, breathability and cut make it really versatile. I also wear it hiking and ski-touring.
review.name: awesome fall/winter jersey

review.reviewBody: Jersey is well thought out and made. But most importantly the fit is good. I am 6 foot tall with long arms and the length of the body and sleeves is more than adequate. There is a small pocket at the right rear that you can fit a power bar and car key in. Not really heavy, so a lot of flexibility as to when and how you use it.  Great for layering with a jacket on cool days or over a base layer all by itself on slightly warmer days.
review.name: Good for spring/fall riding.

name: Singletrack Fleece Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I like this so much I bought one for my brother and my son. The water tastes clean whether I am out hunting and dip into a stream or if I am at the airport and don’t trust the fountain. Only is sue I have had is that it leaks slightly when on its side no matter how snug I make all the interfaces. This doesn’t out weight it’s performance and other advantages.
review.name: Love it and recommend it highly, but leaks when on its side.

review.reviewBody: The 16. 9 Ultrapress is easy to pack and will be insurance in my travels to India.
review.name: Travel Security

review.reviewBody: I work in outside as a heavy equipment operator, rain or shine hot or cold I'm outside sometimes in remote areas. My grayl has gotten me thrugh some tough times where I ran out of water and only had either a stream of water to collect from or a man made water well. . with my grayl I was able to continue working and staying well hydrated with peace of mind that the water I consumed was safe to drink. Thank you grayl for this great product. .
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody:
This one was actually a gift for my daughter. This last summer, my wife used my Grayl for an overnight backpacking trip and loved it. She liked the Grayl better than her Berky!! So, I got her one, however when they went on sale, she ordered one for all of the kids. 

If my wife likes a product so much she buys one for herself and all of her kids……. . That says a lot!
review.name: Another perfect vessel

review.reviewBody: I have not used the bottle yet, but it looks durable and well made. I wish the cap had a tether like the GeoPress model to connect it to the bottle so that it won't be lost if it fell.
review.name: filter water bottle for travel

review.reviewBody: Meets all expectations for design and functionality. Good size for every day use in the backcountry where water supply is prevalent. I'll be evaluating durability over a 100+ nights in the backcountry during the new year.
review.name: Meets all expectations for design

review.reviewBody: I have not had a chance to use this out in nature. But I have tried it a couple times with tap water and it is simple and strait forward. Fairly easy to press down. I like the blue color and it all seems to be well built.
review.name: I have not had a

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and used it on a recent trip. Does the job. Took a bit to get used to but now it’s pretty easy. Must have for any international travel where water is questionable.
review.name: Amazing bottle

review.reviewBody: I bought this both for travel and in case my home well pump ever conks out. It is a simple, compact design that is super easy to use and I like being able to add electrolytes. A BADLY NEEDED DESIGN IMPROVEMENT is a way to keep the small cap attached. I was carrying this purifier in a side pocket of my backpack when I was walking through the airport and I saw the cap roll off down the floor - CRITICAL loss if I had not seen it! It should be attached! Also, the locking ring for the cartridge can be tricky to keep "unlocked" when taking the cartridge on/off - not critical, just a pain.
review.name: Relief to always have safe water

review.reviewBody: I initially purchased the 24oz version but it was very bulky so I exchanged it for the 16oz version. Keep in mind the filter takes up extra space so the bottle fits less water than it looks, so I would only get the larger one if you're on a long hiking/camping trip and don't have a consistent water source. I used this for a 3 week trip to Malaysia and Indonesia, both cities and remote areas, and it was super helpful where the tap water isn't safe or I wanted to avoid the waste of buying bottled water. It took me a few more seconds to press the filter than the instructions said but it's pretty easy to do.
review.name: Great for travel where water is not safe

name: UltraPress Purifier Bottle

These overalls are cute but the fit is a little strange and the quality is not great. The bib part tends to protrude in the chest area so it sticks out oddly, and the fit is in between too tight and loose so that the shorts ride up or sags down in the chest.

Secondly, the overalls ripped on the second wear in the side seam of the shorts. Overalls for this price should not be doing that.

Wish they were better quality and I would buy them in every color.

hasVariant.name: Synch Jumpsuit - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Synch Jumpsuit - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Even though it’s listed as a women’s item, this really could/should be unisex. I sized up to L since I normally wear size M for men’s clothing but turns out that wasn’t necessary.

I had to fasten the shoulders at the tightest position to keep the length from feeling too baggy in the legs. All to say, this runs on the larger side for me in length, waist, and chest. 

Get the right size for yourself and you’ll love this! Cozy and soft and warm with the correct layers.
review.name: Runs large, get your correct size!

name: Synch Jumpsuit - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great! These boots were exactly what I was looking for. My daily hikes and walks with my German Shepherd require me to have water proof, comfortable and sturdy hiking boots. So far they withstood all terrain and weather. I prioritize function and comfort over attractiveness, however these boots check all the boxes. They look great with daily apparel! I have received multiple compliments on these when worn out for everyday activities like shopping, kids functions, lunch with friends and more. 
The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because they do require (as most leather boots do) some minimal time to break in. But then, they fit your foot like a glove. Get these,  you will not be disappointed.
review.name: Get these!!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are so comfortable and lightweight. I love them.
review.name: Women’s hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super Comfy boot. Didn’t even need to break them in. Good color and design
review.name: Comfy Boot

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfortable and keeps my feet dry! I really love these boots, been my go to since I started hiking. I should have ordered 9.5 because these fit true to size! Love them. Have a 9.5 on the way now.
review.name: Great for long hikes!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these on clearance months ago. Wore them for the first time today. They are the most comfortable pair of shoes I own. One of my feet has chronic issues with the little toe getting a pinch ulcer from it being curled under. I didn’t even need my silicone toe cap with these shoes. I was on my feet all day and not once did my little toe hurt. I can’t remember the last time I went all day with no issues, even with the toe cap. I have the black ones with the gray bottom. The leather must be full grain because every scuff buffed out with just my finger. Also, no creasing occurred on top of the shoe, which tends to happen with smooth leather. They must be made from sturdy leather. I couldn’t be happier with the quality and comfort.
review.name: These shoes are awesome!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality, warm, comfortable fit and flattering!
review.name: Awesome, Don’t Hesitate, purchase for yourself!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable and soft. Walking 4-5 mi a day.
Very highly recommended product.
review.name: Great hiking boot

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and very comfortable. Pretty true to size I got the 6.5 and they fit perfect. Great for constant wear. Only down side is that they crease near the toe and it can be bothersome.
review.name: Overall good

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my third pair of Newton Ridge boots. I work as a park ranger in the national parks, so I wear brown hiking boots every day. These are comfortable and waterproof. I do order a slightly larger size so that I can put orthotics in them.
review.name: Ranger perfect!

review.itemreviewed: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable design, lightweight material, easy to put on boots.
review.name: A very good purchase

name: Newton Ridge Plus Hiking Boot - Women's

review.name: Had one pair already -

review.name: Loving the pants. They will

description: Buy the Fjallraven Kanken 17in Laptop Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kanken 17in Laptop Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Kanken 17in Laptop Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kanken 17in Laptop Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Kanken 17in Laptop Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag in 2019 for my eighth grade school year and it has been so amazing and sturdy, I'm only now replacing it for my second semester of college. It perfectly fits my laptop and papers in the back compartment and the main compartment has room for everything I could possibly need. It's my go to backpack for overnight trips, it's my favorite carry-on for planes, and I use it every day for school.

I bought this bag one week ago. I had another kanken backpack (the classic one, it was too little for my pc so I needed one bigger) and It is perfect! I decided to buy from the same brand. After a week of use I’m in love with this backback. It’s very big, so it can hold a lot of stuff. I can’t feel the weight on my shoulders and back, perfect! It’s simple!!! The best!! Love it!!! For me it’s Perfect!
review.name: The Perfect backpack!

review.reviewBody: After having difficulty with another backpack giving me severe headaches, when fully loaded for work. I switched to this 17” Kanken laptop bag and I’m so pleased I did. Everything feels weighted properly. The separate compartment for  laptops is such a good idea.  And the side pockets are great, I can easily fit my water bottle in.  I find the straps very comfortable and no more headaches, which is a bonus!
review.name: 17” Kanken Backpack

review.reviewBody: I think you should have a 17 laptop lavender backpack as I love the colour but it doesn’t fit much in it.

I bout this a month a go and I’m so happy I did because of the amount of stuff it fits. As a commuter I have to take the train every day, and this light weight backpack doesn’t kill my back like some others. I used to own the original Kanken and that was good but this one takes it to the next level. I’m now planning on buying one for my child and wife.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody:
Bought roughly a year ago (ochre) and I've been impressed by how much stuff I can carry.

16inch MacBook Pro, cable box, sunglasses, wallet, organizer, a change of clothes, the mini cooler, iPad, Kindle, umbrella, water bottle, rain jacket, etc.
Literally, everything I can think of can somewhat fit inside this backpack.

Using it against a waxed jacked will permanently stain the back part, that's for sure. No matter how hard I try to wash it, it just won't come clean. The other parts (to my surprise) are still generally pristine, despite of the very stain-prone color I chose.
review.name: Best Kånken ever.

review.reviewBody:
I don’t understand why this backpack is so popular. It’s overpriced and not very functional. I mean really designing a backpack that requires buying additional padded shoulder straps? 
There are much better daypacks that are cheaper with more functionality and comfort available. But if you want to pay a lot to look cool while riding transit then this is the bag for you!
review.name: Overrated!

review.reviewBody:
Five stars for the 20 litre size, square shape, placement of pockets and quality of the material. Still unique among backpacks despite the hype. 
The square shape really makes this very easy to pack and it amazing how much stuff you can fit in it.

However.
Minus three stars for the lack of ergonomic shoulder straps. 
The improved straps of the Kånken Laptop is still light years behind the competition.
You can easily find a backpack from another brand at one third of the price or less that has more ergonomic and comfortable shoulder straps.  
Unfortunately Fjällräven doesn't have any other models that both has the right size, square shape and comfortable shoulder strap.

It would be truly fantastic if Fjällräven could launch a versionof the Kånken Laptop with truly ergonomic shoulder pads. Just do it Fjällräven! 
Every Kånken owner in the world is gonna buy another one!
review.name: Could be perfect except for one major flae.

review.reviewBody:
This is my third fjall raven bag so I already knew the design would be great, 
But the addition of the separate laptop compartment has been surprisingly helpful.
I love having a space for all my things separate from
The padded computer sleeve. The new color is gorgeous too
review.name: Extra space

review.reviewBody: Good laptop sleeve section, however there is zero padding inside or around the bag. The straps are also very thin with no support, so carrying a laptop along with other items really cut into your shoulders and isn’t very comfortable. For the price this backpack was, these basics really surprised me.
review.name: Absolutely no padding or support

name: Kanken 17in Laptop Backpack

review.reviewBody: Great fit and just enough bells and whistles without overdoing it. Handy pockets to carry extra gear when needed. Look nice enough to wear around town in any situation, but comfortable enough to lounge around in. Ended up buying a couple color ways. Love these pants.
review.name: So nice, I bought them twice!

review.reviewBody: Well appointed pant. Next level comfort and function. Can be worn with a lite, mid or heavy base layer and you are ready all day for whatever happens
review.name: Great Pant

review.reviewBody: Decided to give these pants (Livsn Ecotrek Trail Pant) a try after reading some good reviews of them, and boy, were they spot on!  Nice, soft feel to the material, and "bulletproof" construction.  Plenty of pockets, with many of them zippered.  It's obvious that these pants were well engineered and put together appropriately.  Great slim fit, and true to size.  (I bought my usual 32/32 and they fit perfectly.)  Can't wait to get another pair in another color.
review.name: Bulletproof!

review.reviewBody: Simply love these pants!!  Rafting, hiking, backpacking, slot canyons you name it!  Recently used them in southern Utah for slot canyons and backpacking Harris Wash - bushwacking through Tamarisk and wading the creek for week.  No rips, dried super fast, comfortable, stretchy.  Others destroyed their light weight nylon pants either in the canyons or through the brush.  Can say enough about these!
review.name: Best active pants EVER

review.reviewBody: Why does this website not sell size 31x32? That’s the size I need.
review.name: Need size 31x32

name: Ecotrek Trail Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Medium fits my 9 year old perfectly. Not too bulky or thin. This jacket is perfect for cold weather in the Midwest while still allowing my daughter flexibility to move and play.
review.name: Works for active child

review.itemreviewed: Katelyn Crest III Hooded Jacket - Girls'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely  love this Columbia coat for my children! It does an amazing job of keeping the wind away, which is essential during colder months. The length is perfect, as it goes past their hips, providing extra warmth and coverage. The material feels high-quality and durable, so I know it will last through all their outdoor adventures. It’s lightweight but still incredibly warm, and my kids stay cozy without feeling too bulky. Plus, the design is stylish, so they actually enjoy wearing it. This coat has definitely exceeded my expectations — highly recommend for parents looking for reliable winter protection for their little ones!
review.name: 5 star

review.reviewBody: So disappointing.  I got these mainly to be a one layer option to take the dog on his first walk...My thighs freeze. They trap enough body heat to not be able to wear on cool days. On the other hand on cold days, the icy air blows right through them. I also wished they were higher waisted.  I generally really like mountain hardware, but these massively miss the mark.
review.name: Not appropriate for any weather.

review.reviewBody: I bought these in the hopes that they might become my winter go-to all rounder pant. I love a good lined pant! These fit okay and are very comfortable, but WHERE ARE THE POCKETS??? Do you know how hard it is to find pants for women with adequate pockets? This pant has potential, but needs more pockets. I don't have a sherpa nor do I carry a purse, so one little pocket on the thigh is simply not enough to make these very useful for anything but lounging on the couch. Perhaps the outside porch couch.
review.name: Pants Need Pockets

review.reviewBody: The lined pant has the perfect amount of warmth and stretch for any activity!
review.name: Amazing winter pant

review.reviewBody: I bought these as they claimed they had a 32" inseam.  They don't and are too short, I measured and the inseam is only 29", this is in the XS.  Very disappointed I now have to return and keep looking for a brand that actually makes a longer inseam for women.
review.name: Too Short

name: Yumalina Lined Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wear it as a mid layer while skiing.  It was perfect when temps were zero to one degree F in the morning and up to low 30s in the afternoon.  
Layered between base layer and insulated jacket, it was perfect.  Not bulky, but still warm. 
Quality is good, as is typical from OR.  
I definitely recommend this fleece.
review.name: Comfortable and Warm

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fleece, but is only fleece on the inside and nylon outside that is hard to discern in the photos. The grid is from the fleece on the inside which shows through on the outside as subtle variations in the nylon outer layer. Again very interesting and attractive, but not your normal fleece. I use is with a T-shirt as a base layer. But can also be worn over just about anything. Is fairly light weight and breathable. Very comfortable and stylish.
review.name: Read Carefully

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is fantastic, except it runs small. Only reason not 5 stars
review.name: Great item, but

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This was a warranty replacement for a previous version of this product. The warranty process was quick and reasonable, and I love my new Vigor Half Zip as much as I loved the old one.
review.name: Love my Vigor Half Zip Top

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This fleece is lightweight, allows movement and the fit is good. Im using as a warmer layer above a base layer and there is enough flexibility to wear while sport climbing on cool days.
review.name: Great for cooler sport climbing days

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not sure which is the correct sizing..... I ordered 2 of these in the same size XXL and the one made in Vietnam color black is one size larger than the one made in Indonesia which is color spice. I had the same issue with my 2 XXL Men's Vigor Plus Fleece Jackets. The Black was a size larger than the blue. It seems OR has an issue with fierce being inconsistent wit sizing depending on the country is made in. Other than the sizing issues the quality is excellent.
review.name: Inconsistent sizing - Vietnam / Indonesia

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit -- not too snug, not too loose. Light to medium weight is perfect for hiking in 50-60 degree weather, or as a baselayer in colder temps. And the waffle fabric feels great next to the skin.
review.name: Fits the product description perfectly

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfy and soft. Reminds me of the army poly pro
review.name: Comfy and soft

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I regularly use this as a mid-layer on winter hikes in the Pacific Northwest. I love the fit and it keeps me warm. I'll likely buy another.
review.name: My favorite mid-layer

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this as my mid layer for our annual Mt. Washington hike up the Lions Head Winter Route. With this mid layer fleece, a pair of alpine onset 150 bottoms and half zip top, and OR Snow Pants - that combo got me through perfectly until we got above the tree line and had to layer up further. 10 degrees outside not including the 20mph sustained winds before we got above tue trees. The moisture wicking, comfort, and heat retention/breathability were exactly what I needed to make the hike a success this year and never get my clothes wet from sweat. Warmth, moisture wicking, and comfort. Mt. Washington Winter approved.
review.name: Mt. Washington Winter Approved

name: Vigor Grid Fleece Half-Zip Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Use rarely
review.name: Use rarely

review.reviewBody: I used my straw for the first time yesterday and I was super pleased that it actually did work. I could draw all the water up the water container easily and it was much more comfortable than cranking my head down directly to the container on my chest. It's funny looking to have that straw sticking up over my shoulder but I don't care much about that anyway. I didn't give it a "great" because it did pop off the container top a couple of times because it doesn't sit super-securely like something you would screw on - it is just pushed down over the existing cap after you take off the other white sucking tip. I'm using the straw with the Women's Ultra Pro Vest 34 oz. Hope that helps.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes so much! The downturn is incredibly aggressive, its a pretty uncomfortable shoe if you go for the performance fit, and the overall breaking in period is really long, but these shoes are so precise that your feet and heel feel like extensions of your hands. The heel on these shoes is incredible, I feel very secure. Overall, this is the best climbing shoe on the market.
review.name: Precise.

review.reviewBody: This shoe was everything the hype said it would be. I felt solid heel hooking as well as toe hooking in these. I'm a women's 7 in US street shoe. I sized down 2 full US sizes and I bought these in 36 EUR/5.5 USW. They fit perfectly. The next half size down was a bit too painful to put on, these were just tight enough to bear comfortably while breaking them in. I did end up returning them because my foot was going numb in the right shoe. The shape of the shoe was surprisingly too narrow around my forefoot and I thought I broke my toe in it at one point, after I slipped off a hold. I played it safe and sent them back, but had the shoe fit the front of my foot better, then these would have been a dream.
review.name: Amazing Shoe, but Not My Foot Shape ):

review.reviewBody:
Love the shoe and how it feels when I?m on a steep overhang, being a male with wide feet, maybe wasn?t the best idea with these shoes but sacrifice comfort for performance and it works well for the task at hand.
A little snug for me but that?s due to my naturally wide feet.
review.name: Snug...maybe a little too snug

review.reviewBody: Got my first pair of these about 8 or so months ago and they've held up really well. At first I was a little concerned they may not fit the shape of my foot as well as I wanted, but as the broke in, that issue got a lot better. They've served me really well and still have some life in them!
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are my favorite fit and toe I've ever had, but the straps started breaking within the first few months and a little later the rubber for the hooks started fraying up. These would totally be my favorite shoes if they didn't fall apart within the first year! I would only get these if you have money to buy a new pair within a year. Make a more durable pair and I'm sold!!
review.name: Not Durable

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair in the new colors. Seem to be right in line with the old pink ones. Great shoe. On one of them the stitching feels a bit rough and abrasive on my heel, but I'm sure it will calm down with some breaking in.
review.name: Just like the pink ones

review.reviewBody: I use these shoes for everything from sport climbing inside and outside to bouldering competitions and outside boulders. They smear well, edge well, heel hook well, and can toe hook just about everything. All angles of wall are no match for this shoe. They are able to toe in on the steeps, and edge like no other on the vert and slabs.
review.name: Well rounded shoe

review.reviewBody: My favorite shoes. I'm a kid, but also a real climber so the women's solutions come in sizes that work for me even though they are not kids shoes.
review.name: Great for serious kid climbers

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing the solution for nearly 10 years! They continue to impress me when it comes to edging and heel hooking on rock. The women's solution is nice, because the lower volume fits my foot even better!
review.name: Best outdoor shoe

review.reviewBody: These are the only shoe I wear when bouldering any rock other than slab. These toe hook like no other shoe on the market. They are also good for heel hooking and the rubber is so sticky!  I bought the same size in this model as the previous woman's model. I bought this shoe one size up from the previous man's model.
review.name: The BEST shoe for roof bouldering

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] kept me warm (down to 1 degrees celcius)! packs down small. LOVE the option of the half zip on one side and full zip on the other
review.name: LOVE IT

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Trek down sleeping bag is so comfortable. It folds down into a very small space. I love the color and how compact it is. It will keep you nice and warm. I highly recommend this product.
review.name: Very soft

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I went camping by the beach and this kept me incredibly warm. It fit me well and was enough for my legs to move around a bit. It was very comfortable and lightweight.
review.name: Great sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Trek Down Sleeping Bag for Women, Regular 15F | -9C, is a high-quality, versatile option for outdoor enthusiasts. Designed specifically for women, it features 650+ Loft ULTRA-DRY Down for excellent warmth-to-weight ratio and moisture resistance. The sleeping bag is spacious, allowing for comfortable movement, and includes a contoured hood and draft collar to retain heat. It's suitable for temperatures down to -9°C (15°F), making it ideal for three-season use. Overralcthisnis greet for camping or backpacking in cold climates for adventures! It comes with a storage bag as well which is great!
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag can keep me warm even in really cool temperatures. I go both tent camping and camper camping (sometimes without heat while doing the latter.) I love the blue color. It’s very appealing to me. However, from the get go the snaps at the top of the sleeping bag broke off. This should never happen on the first use.  There also appeared to be no way for me to even sew them back on. Since this is a mummy bag the top is supposed to go up and keep my head warm.  I’m an average height and female. I felt that the top didn’t leave enough room to go over my head.  When I tried to turn on my side it was quite uncomfortable. The only way to lay is truly on my back the entire night.   The sleeping bag allows me to unzip at the bottom for my feet, however, that made me feet cold so I zipped it back up. The bag is made of down which is warm but that meant several feathers came out immediately. I tried to use the inner zipper at the top once I was in the bag and the zipper was not smooth.  While the bag is warm, it is uncomfortable and very poorly made. I won’t be using this again and will go back to my regular sleeping bag for camping.
review.name: Great color but very poor quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the hooded part of the sleeping bag. It’ll be extra warm and comfortable for the head and face. The bottom of the bag has a zipper to let air circulate around the feet. The color of the bag is so vibrant and beautiful. I love the turquoise color. It’s super soft with the down insulation and the outside material is soft to touch. It’s gonna be so fun to use out on camping trips in the future.
review.name: Gorgeous color and I love the design and materials

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is really nice! It really does keep you warm! It is very comfortable and fits me perfectly! It’s easy to back up and light to carry too
review.name: Very nice sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! What a well thought out sleeping bag! Not only is it super comfortable and very well insulated, it has so many excellent ventilation zippers that make it great for so many different temperatures!
review.name: Well Thought out and Cozy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven’t gotten to actually use this product yet but I know it’s going to be amazing. It’s extremely well made, very warm and cozy. It folds up nicely for easy transport and could be taken backpacking as well. I’m super excited for our next camping trip!
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Trek Down Sleeping Bag for women in regular size (15F) is a top-notch choice for cold weather adventures. Its lightweight design and high-quality materials make it ideal for backpacking. The warmth and comfort it provides ensure a cozy night's sleep even in chilly conditions. Highly recommended for female outdoor enthusiasts seeking reliable gear for their expeditions.
review.name: Best choice

That’s it.

review.reviewBody: I love this! So well done. So many well thought out details. Love the chest and hand pocket placement and size. Great amount of storage with only 4 pockets that are placed to work perfectly with a pack on.  Orange color is high viz without looking like a crossing guard and really looks good.
review.name: A 5 star for sure

review.reviewBody:
This is the ultimate tool for outdoor activies period. I used the exposure 2 GT-pro for the past 5 years and was already satisfied but it was lacking the side pockets. This new iteration called now the routefinder has 2 chest pocket and 2 side pockets. The deep black version is so clean. The fabric seems to be even of higher quality then its predecessor.  The hood adjustment was redesign I would say. The finish of the interior has been reviewed also and will stand the test of time.

Best new shell of 2023 by far
review.name: Rugged and clean

review.reviewBody:
I know this product has mixed reviews, but I honestly really enjoy the overalls I have. I've worn them for about a year now, and I've dressed them up and down, all winter and fall long.

In terms of comfort and warmth, I'd say it definitely works well on most cooler days, but I wouldn't wear this alone when it's particularly cold outside. The ripstop on the fabric feels super sturdy, and I'd say I'm comfortable from 50F to 70F without anything else under them, but I'd definitely consider wearing either long johns or another pair of pants under them if it gets particularly cold (the wind can catch in the bagginess). That being said, they work well up until about 70F, so they're pretty versatile.

In terms of sizing, I think I'm an exception, but I have some thoughts (I'm 5'11, and really skinny, so things with set waist and length combinations don't do particularly well on me). I normally wear 30W 32L pants, and so I got a size M in Pinecone, which I thought felt a little baggy, but mostly work well on me. I think my two notes are that the legs and seat feel big (so I can comfortably wear another thick pair of pants under them), and the legs are long (I tend to roll / cuff them), even though the chest feels right for a shirt size M. I would perhaps recommend sizing down if you have the chest space for it, but otherwise I don't think the bagginess is too noticeable (it looks good under most contexts).

With good layerability (wear over pants, under a hoodie, etc.), I would recommend this on the whole, since I haven't found another pair of overalls at this price point and with this style! I think the buckles and straps are super stylish, and I love to wear them with just one strap on.

Just know the right size for you before you buy, and try it on before confirming.
review.name: Wear this all the time

review.reviewBody: The medium in stretch limo black was quite a bit smaller than medium in pinecone. Wasn’t expecting that.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I got these about a month ago, I have been using them constantly they have done all sorts of things with me from hiking to just hanging out and traveling in them. Then have been great and comfortable the entire time
review.name: I like these a lot

review.reviewBody: I do like the quality feel of the overalls. I think that would be the limit of what I like though. You can look elsewhere for better fitting overalls. I am a 6' foot male at 150 lbs and having a slim build with broad shoulders and a small butt does not work at all with this design. The zipper at the waist is essentially useless providing no actual function. If you look at the models in the photos they are actually pulling the slack when the model around the waist to make it look like it fits better. I would have given this three stars but geeze bro, you are asking the models to deceive consumers. Does in fact make you look like you are wearing a diaper. Unless you are a body builder with giant legs, butt, and arms, this will not look good on you. Sorry not sorry.
review.name: Decent quality; poor sizing design

review.reviewBody: These overalls are good quality and durable they've been enduring work. However, there is extra fabric in the back its to baggy. It doesn't look like I'm wearing a diaper but it could be tighter.
review.name: Baggy in the wrong places

review.reviewBody: size up!  Looks stylish and has a great fit. legs are a bit long, so y husband cuffs the pants which look great. You can wear it with a shirt or with a heavier sweater underneath.
review.name: Awesome coveralls!

review.reviewBody: ordered L & XL. while the large ran smaller than expected the extra large was too big. returned both.
review.name: Wacky Sizing

review.reviewBody: I wear a 32 waist and a medium is too tight when wearing anything but a t-shirt on top (even before washing.  The straps are a stretchy but not especially tough elastic. Length fits like a 32-34.
review.name: Waist runs small, chintzy straps

review.reviewBody:
Never had overalls before, but I'm glad I gave these a shot, as I quickly realized that I really like wearing them.  The fabric has a bit of stretch/give, which is nice for movement, and the shoulder straps are a comfortable stretch webbing that also aids in moving, and makes sitting down a breeze.  A left side zipper makes entry and exit easier, and you can zip it down to take pressure off your fat gut when sitting.  

Just a note on sizing:  I got the XXL and I am 6 feet tall with a 43 inch waist, 46 inch gut, and 44 inch chest.  The XXL works well for me, but I have to unzip the side zipper when I sit for long periods of time.  If your gut is larger than 46" these probably will NOT work for you.  At my height of 6' (I have a 30" inseam) the length of these overalls is perfect when walking and hiking...when I take off my shoes inside, I just fold the cuff up once (about 2 inches) and they fit perfect.

I find them very nice for walking.  No belt to dig into my waist, and no constantly hitching up my pants.  I do have to occasionally fidget with the shoulder straps, but rarely.  I still wear pants with belts on occasion, but usually go back to overalls (or pants w suspenders) pretty quickly.  These are nice in cool/cold weather as they provide a bit of extra coverage for your torso, without interfering with arm movement.

I wouldn't mind a right thigh pocket for  a tool/flashlight/cell phone or what-have-you, but I also like the clean design as is.  And besides, there are plenty of pockets already.  I also would not mind if the chest pockets had closures of some kind...but these are just "minor quibbles" as they say.
review.name: I Like 'Em.

review.reviewBody: From backpacking in the fall, mountain biking, house parties, and fly fishing. These overalls work great, are durable, and are so comfortable. Little tight when you belly up to the bar but the zip on the side helps with that, and maybe a few less barley pops would too
review.name: Great set of overalls

review.reviewBody: I bought these site unseen and loved the fit and the side zipper vents. They feel like the same thickness as my OR  cirque pants and I will use them for spring and winter mountaineering climbs.

review.reviewBody: I live in the Pacific Northwest and do a fair bit of mountaineering and alpine touring. These are my go-to pants. There are a ton of great features, and the material is super durable, waterproof, while being breathable. I just summited Hood in them, skiing up 3/4 of the way and climbing the rest -- pants performed beautifully. Just be sure to size up.
review.name: The BEST pants for any alpine activity

review.reviewBody: After too many years with my old ski pants, I finally upgraded to these Taiss Guide pants.  I am in love. The fit is great.  I am a 'curvy' woman and I have never found ski pants that fit this well (included other Mammut styles). The velcro waistband is a game changer if you are not boy-shaped (ie, have hips and a butt).  I want to go skiing just so I can wear my new pants! I overheat easily, but the fabric of these pants is perfect and the side vents are well placed and quick and easy to open and close.  I love the flat pockets, but wish that the thigh pockets had a little gusset in it so that my beacon had a little more space (but this is a minor detail, it is a little bit of a tight fit, but I don't notice it at all while touring).  The only thing that I would change is the gaiter system.  It is very well designed, but it is a tight fit around ski boots that are loosened for climbing.  They are a great fit when my boots are buckled for the descent, but I have to mess around with them a bit to get a good enough seal to keep snow out while my boots are loose for the skin up. The design is great, I'm impressed, but I'm afraid that they aren't going to last as long as I would like with all of the pulling and stretching I have to do to get them around my boot. Overall, I'm very satisfied with these ski pants.
review.name: Great Backcoutry Ski Pants, with one caveat

review.reviewBody: I measured according to the size chart and the product is way off. Or the chart is.
review.name: Sizing is off

review.reviewBody: I buy a lot of Mammut clothing and the pants fit differently every time. Usually, as a 5'4" 130lb athletic lady, I am a size 4. These pants are great for ski touring, but fit just a tad tight. I love the light fabric and vents on the legs, as well as the reinforced pant legs for crampons.
review.name: Great softshell, but fits small

review.reviewBody: These are beautiful pants.  I will wear them for rainy hikes in the fall & spring.  They will also be great for backcountry skiing & snowshoeing.  The only issue is the sizing is confusing.  A 4 is a US X-small.  6 is a US small, etc.  I'm 5'9", 123 lbs.  Normally, I'd wear a 2 or 4 in US, but had to size up to 6.
review.name: Awesome pants

name: Taiss Guide SO Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'm a fan of Solomon hiking boots as they give my average-width feet room to spread out without the boots feeling too wide overall. My regular Salomon hiking boots aren't really warm enough for hiking or snowshoeing in Vermont winters, so I was pleased to find this newest winter hiking boot offering. I usually wear a 7.5 street shoe and found I did not need to size up for these boots. They are sturdy and warm without feeling overly heavy or clunky. They are a bit stiffer than my regular hikers, but that wasn't a deal breaker for me as I'm looking for more winter protection. I have shorter legs, so I appreciate the modest mid boot height compared to other competitors, which improves boot flexibility for me. The traction on ice and snow is excellent. I highly recommend these boots.
review.name: Comfortable winter hiking boot

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Pocket Shower online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pocket Shower
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Pocket Shower online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The solar showerr really works well. It’s good for camping and backpacking. Nice stream, plenty of water, heats up pretty fast. I love mine!
review.name: Solar shower: compact and great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A comfortable shower, you caA comfortable and very easy-to-use shower. You can rinse yourself, or you can use it for washing dishes - like a water tapn wash yourself, or you can wash the dishes
review.name: Pocket Shower (Like New)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Many things are very liberating in the outdoors. Being able to take a shower is one of those things. This pocket shower is great to fill up in the morning and allow the water to warm up during the day. After setting up camp, cooking, and clean up, a shower before bed is very relaxing.
review.name: Cleaning up before bed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Already had the bigger one. Needed a smaller one for personal use. Getting older and finding the bigger one too heavy to lift. Also, this one heats up much faster and is enough water for one person to shower. Doing a lot more solo bike touring these days.
review.name: Easy to hold up with one hand

review.reviewBody: I love that it holds enough water and the bag feels sturdy. You can hang it up which admittedly I have yet to try but I like that I can hold it and easily wash my hair and my body. I've tried a couple camp showers that run on batteries and while they work fine they require a bucket or container large enough to be able to keep the motorized part submerged and if I'm trying to switch it off while I leave the conditioner in, etc, I get soap in the water and I keep dropping the handle because it has nowhere to go.. it's annoying. But this thing is so simple and I can even adjust the water flow. The lowest setting was perfect and enough for me to shampoo my hair twice and conditioner. I love that I can turn it inside out to make sure it's completely dry before storing it (don't have to worry about if there's mold growing inside and easy to clean) AND it's quick and easy to fold and pack away into that tiny bag. It's lightweight enough for me but even if it was as heavy as a rock I'd still carry this thing to the ends of the earth because having a shower is my camping/backpacking luxury item I suppose.
review.name: probably my most favorite item that I own

review.reviewBody: After traveling with my wife and 4 kids to the GRSM and not having access to a public shower, I immediately got back and found this shower. We traveled to the Dakotas for 13 nights (TRNP, Wind Cave, Badlands) and had access to showers, but I still used this guy after long hikes and just around camp to give it a go. Easy enough set up and so far has not leaked. Would love to see the attaching to a tree or other item be a bit simpler, but for the size and weight, probably not worth it. For sure recommend.
review.name: Useful and effective

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome product. 
There’s nothing like a campsite shower after a long trail day. You sleep better and your bedding stays clean. 
Never backpack without it!
review.name: Clean Sleep!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First one had a crack inside the shower part and leaked. Contacted S2S and they replaced it. Great product, extremely light and works very well.
review.name: Second times the charm

review.reviewBody:
I've had one of these for several years now and love having a wash-up available at camp. I've also been lucky enough to camp at a few places that had purpose-built shelters with pulleys, just add solar shower (like this one!)

This year, though, I filled it up and it began to seep everywhere - the fabric lost much of its water tightness, reasonable after 10 years of use. I contacted Seat to Summit to see how I could fix this and they generously responded with a brand new one under warranty.

With customer service like this I'll shop Sea to Summit products first for my next round of gear.
review.name: Great camping luxury, great customer service

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This little thing is amazing! This has made camping showers so much easier. I don’t even hang it in the tree. I just take it into our shower pod with me in and use it like a movable showerhead. The cool thing is when you roll the top of it up there’s air in there and it’s pressurized so the water comes out easily. Brilliant!
review.name: Pocket Shower

name: Pocket Shower

review.itemreviewed: Smoker Bandit Oar - Wrap + Stop + Standard Blade
review.reviewBody: I bought these because of the length and lightness. Being a wood oar snob for so long it was hard to make the jump to carbon fiber, but this was a good jump. Interested to see how the finish takes exposure to sunshine and salt water. I like the turned wood handles and grip. I like the branding on the shaft, but not so much on the blades. The standard blades pulled well. The wrapped shaft was in the right position for the oar lock. The rubber collar donut stays put. I put a good 3 miles on them my first time out, and they felt good, nice to balance and pull. The wrapped shaft feathered nicely.  Looking forward to getting another set for both rowing stations to pull together.
review.name: Stout, Light, Reliable Oars

name: Smoker Bandit Oar - Wrap + Stop + Standard Blade

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product turned out to be very durable, versatile, and unexpectedly functional! He said he will now be a customer and love the product!
review.name: Great for hunters in the woods!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Adventure Ready Trowel Toilet Kit is a must-have for outdoor enthusiasts. This compact and lightweight kit includes a durable trowel, biodegradable waste bags, and hand sanitizer, making it ideal for backcountry trips. The trowel is sturdy and easy to use, efficiently digging into various soil types. The waste bags are environmentally friendly and seal well, ensuring a mess-free experience. The inclusion of hand sanitizer adds an extra layer of hygiene. Overall, it's a well-thought-out, practical solution for outdoor sanitation needs, promoting both convenience and environmental responsibility.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is really my husband's favorite dish because he loves to go fishing. Many wild places do not have toilets, which is very convenient, Very convenient !!
review.name: Very convenient !!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've only really messed around with it, and will update after bringing in-field next week if my opinion changes, but, it's a great product! It's the perfect size for field pack, seems pretty sturdy, and I love that it comes with refills.
review.name: Great Tool for the Outdoors!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is unique and different but very practical.  Everything that you need to dig a hole and do your business is there in one package.
Lightweight and has a nice carrying strap. The shovel is a decent size. 
It's definitely great to have when spending time in the outdoors
review.name: Many uses rolled into one package

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a new must for all campers! It’s a way to keep your toilet paper dry but also compact so it’s easy to bring along and throw it in your backpack. Very cool idea!
review.name: Camping ready

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This ‘Adventure Ready Trowel Kit’ is everything you would expect it to be. 
 Its so portable and lightweight, yet carries everything you need for the outdoors. 
 Unscrew the top, you’ve got toilet tissue. Pull off the bottom, you’ve got your digging trowel. Also pop the cap up on the little container, youve got soap chips!
 Pop open the bottom of the container, youve got towelettes!
 This thing is awesome, ill never spend time outdoors again without it!
review.name: You NEED This!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After a few weeks I like the Boxio. You have to learn where to sit for 1 or 2. I was too far forward and did 2 into pee area. Then I was too far back and peed in 2 bin. Takes a while to get the right feel when sitting down. Also, it is light and needs to be secured somehow. oops, it rolled over. put heavy box of stuff in front when traveling now. No odor but I keep a bottle of odoban to spray in pee section every few times.
review.name: Basically great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sturdy metal, easy to use. Don’t use it on hard dirt but it will work on regular soil. I like that it has toilet paper, soap and washcloths for your hands. Highly recommend for any camper/hiker.
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is very durable.  It is easy to carry    It is very comfortable to use.  It has lots of uses.   My dad loves it for hunting    It is very effective    It packs well.
review.name: Toilet

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a terrific and very reasonably priced 650 fill-power down jacket. No leaks so far, and the shell looks robust (and is claimed to have a DWR finish). So far so good.

I *really* miss having a chest pocket either inside or outside for my phone. Yes, you can drop it "behind" the pockets, but they're really deep and it's awkward to fish the phone (or anything else) out. Besides the convenience of a chest pocket, it can be very helpful for keeping the phone warm to preserve battery life. Again, the behind-the-pocket-pockets can do that, but not very well.

Finally, the sizing is ridiculous. I'm 6'2" and just over 200 pounds, and a *Medium* fits almost perfectly (just a little snug across the shoulders). I would have been swimming in a Large, particularly around the gut. This isn't unique to this jacket; I returned an Omni-Heat jacket in favor of this one, and it was a Medium as well. I'm short-leg (32")/long-torso, and the torso and arm length of this jacket are spot-on, not too short at all. Really, in what universe is someone my size a medium??
review.name: Great jacket. No chest pocket. Bizarre sizing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket is meticulously designed and comfortable
review.name: Outstanding Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this jacket for my boyfriend and he loves it. It fits true to size and is light weight yet nice and warm. It allows him to be outdoors and do what he needs to do without that "bulk" you usually have with warm jackets.
review.name: Light yet warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good
review.name: good

review.reviewBody: When I received the Anon Rodan MIPS helmet I realized that the ventilation holes are too small. Curiously, the non-MIPS version of this helmet has larger ventilation holes. Otherwise, this seems to be a great helmet: lightweight and comfortable. The BOA system makes it fit perfectly. The pockets for audio are sealed with velcro. But skiing in Southern California can get hot, so I am going to exchange it for the Anon Echo, which has much better ventilation.
review.name: Too little ventilation

review.reviewBody: I love the light weight of it, but that's about it.  This vest is way too long and, without a double up-down zipper that would relieve the tightness at the hips when seated, it's just uncomfortable as hell.  I love the roomy zippered outer chest pocket, but when you put both cell phone and wallet in there (which seems safer than a side pocket to me), the jacket hangs weirdly lopsided. An inside pocket on the opposite side would have been really nice.
review.name: It might have been wonderful...
comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great warmth.  Would love a petite option - arms holes too big and shoulders too high, but that does make it good for bulkier hoodies underneath.
review.name: Good Vest - Warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought 3 of these vests for family members and they all wear them everyday around the house and when out and about.  I got them on sale with additional discount so great value for 700-down power fill with lifetime warranty.  I also got the men's version for myself and am wearing it now while I'm typing this review.
review.name: Women's Highlander Down Vest

review.reviewBody: Love this vest!  I’ve worn it under a ski jacket and used it playing tennis too.
review.name: Highlander vest

review.reviewBody: The color is just what I was looking for and compliments both greens and blues. I bought it based on color as I have another down vest from Patagonia that is more a bight turquiose and wanted something a bit more subtle. Both are good - the collar on this stands a bit higher, the Patagonia has 90% goose down, this has 85%Duck down and 15% duckfeathers. This does have a nice chest pocket tho.
review.name: Perfect Color for me

review.reviewBody: I received the vest in black. The fit is perfect, and quality is excellent. Very pleased.
review.name: Great vest!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect best - light but warm for those cold but sunny days in Texas!
review.name: Perfect for Dallas’ sunny winter days!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great vest. Love it! When it went on sale I bought it immediately. Its so light, not bulky, doesn't make you look bigger.  Great length on me, I bought xl I'm 5"8"  is longer on me than what it looks like on models. Sizing is correct.
review.name: I have been wanting this vest for awhile!

review.reviewBody: What a Great Vest! Fits well. Warm. Love it. What more could you need/
review.name: Most Excellent!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I picked this vest out for a Christmas gift. It fits very well, with slight waist shape- less than I wanted but it turns out it looks great! I thought the vest was slight on the front dorm fill, but discovered it was just from the packing! It just took time to expand. It is very comparable to the Patagonia sweater vest, but at a much more reasonable price. Very nice quality! True to size. I am a petite 6-8 and the Small fits perfectly. My
Measurements: Bust 35.5, Waist 29, Hip 37
review.name: Great Fit!

review.reviewBody: I’m new to backcountry skiing but skied all my life. I’m really enjoying these gloves since they are longer. Very comfy fit and the ‘seatbelt’ strap keeps ‘em close to re-glove quicker.
review.name: Perfect addition to backcountry skiing!

review.reviewBody:
I had the opportunity to wear these on two Boarding trips before the end of my season.  They were warm and not too warm.  One of my outings was very close to zero Fahrenheit and I had no cold issues.  The other trip was fairly warm, and my hands did not overheat as they have in other gloves I own.

They also stayed very dry.  No wet glove experienced.  As far as durability, as mentioned in other reviews, I will have to wait and see.  Out of the box I did not find and QC issues.  Came as advertised and in supreme condition.  I am aware of issues with goat skin and water/wear and tear.  I own a few sets of pilots gloves and have experience deterioration from use and shrinking from water exposure.  To date, I have had no issues.  As I am aware of the delicate nature of the goat skin, I would not use these in a tow rope situation.  I have a special set of gloves for tow rope use (those can rip up a less rugged glove easy).  Knowing the limits of the material comes in handy ahead of time.

overall fit an finish, I am thoroughly satisfied.  For the price, these are great feeling, fitting and looking gloves.
review.name: Great Fit, Warm and Dry

review.reviewBody: I have used these for skiing and snowmobiling. They are awesome! Comfy and lots of dexterity, but warm. I love that the liner doesn't come out and bunch up like a lot of other gloves.
review.name: Durable, warm, and so comfy

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn skiing a couple days & have found the gloves to be warm & comfortable. They feel durable. Hopefully will survive the wear & tear of a couple ski seasons
review.name: Solid gloves

review.reviewBody: I bought these on sale and was looking for good-looking black/natural leather Gore-tex gloves for skiing.   These fit the bill.  The fit is good for XL, and I like the leashes and cuff closure pull straps.   Haven't used them in warmer/rainy ski conditions which is really why I need Gore-tex, so the jury is still out on that.  They look great and fit/perform well.
review.name: Great overall gloves

review.reviewBody: After three uses they split between the fingers at the seam. Backcountry said they didn’t think it was a manufacturer fail, but did honor an exchange or store credit. Overall spend the extra cash and get some arcteryx.
review.name: Warm but won’t last

review.reviewBody: I have been skiing with this glove for two seasons now and have no complaints. There are warmer gloves out there but these do just fine in northern Utah and I can also use them during the warmer spring months. Price is great and the large size fits similar to other brands.
review.name: Better than most

review.reviewBody: Have used it for skiing in 10 degree weather, hands stayed warm the entire time. Fit is great based off of the size chart. I have skied with them 4 times now and have had no issues.
review.name: Great glove

review.reviewBody:
Used it for 3 hours on for resort skiing and the leather in one of the palms already looked stressed.  I bought it in spite of the only other review ( 1-star) to give the product one more chance and judge for myself.  
The sizing is therefore secondary, but I found it  very snug. It but would definitely not take an inner lining if needed - this thought came to me since it was not the warmest of gloves.
review.name: Leather looks it wont last

review.reviewBody: Gloves tore apart after the second use for no obvious reason. That's not what I expected from premium priced gloves.  Customer care was even worse, refused to pay for international return and never answered back on emails.
review.name: Disappointing product & customer service

name: GORE-TEX All-Mountain Glove

review.reviewBody: Overall good light jacket, protects from wind quite good - but front zipper is terrible. Often takes a lot of jiggling to get it to zip up, and also tends to get stuck in fabric when unzipping. Nice jacket but would not expect such issues at this price point
review.name: Good jacket, poor zipper

review.reviewBody:
Jacket is nice but the hood is too baggy and there is no drawcord adjustment, its a tight fit like most fjallraven jackets. I’m a 34 waist and large only just fits! 

It's definitely time for fjallraven to work on..
1. Zips
2. Sizing
3. Drawcords on all hoods
review.name: Ok, but the hood!

review.reviewBody: I've had this for 2 years now, and I'm just now seeing any issues (zipper). This was my first item from Fjallraven, so I was new to the whole upkeep process with G-1000 materials. Understand that this is not a heavy storm/foul weather jacket. It works great for limited exposure to rain. It will keep you dry, only if you maintain the wax layer. I'm 6'1" and about 190lbs and the Medium fits snuggly, not any room for layering.
review.name: Great light jacket

review.reviewBody: A well made but very basic jacket, unlined, no hood adjustment. It works well in spring and early autumn days, without rain. First time I got caught in a shower I got soaked, fabric wetted out immediately and seams are open.
review.name: Well made, but not for wet weather at all

review.reviewBody:
I am 5'10" in height and 155 lbs for reference, purchased a size L.
This jacket suits pretty much any situation I need it for. The fit is awesome throughout and the sleeves are the perfect length to slightly cover my hands. The shape and size of the hood is perfect in my opinion. The fit allows for me to wear base layers, a hoodie, and a thinner insulation layer fairly comfortably. 
I have heavily waxed the hood and shoulders on this jacket and lightly waxed the rest. While still not 100% waterproof, I was genuinely impressed with the performance. I walked through a renaissance faire for a full day in medium rain and only the sleeves near my wrists wetted through slightly. 
One drawback to the jacket are the sleeve cuffs, I wish they were elastic or had more snap adjustment points. I love to push my sleeves up and the two buttons are either too small to use with the inner layers or too big to keep my sleeves retained higher. This is a minor nitpick and I would definitely recommend the Sten.
review.name: Pretty Great

review.reviewBody:
This is a great jacket and was exactly what I was looking for. I’ve had the opportunity to wear it through some light rain (no wax applied) and it performed well.

I’m 5’11, 195lbs with longer arms and the size M is almost perfect. It’s a little tight through the chest, but the sleeves and everything else are on point.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Perfect for wearing around town. Rugged enough to resist weather and comfortable / stylish to wear everyday.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket - it’s a nice slim fit, made from good quality fabric and with minimal branding. Overall it looks really nice! However, what it is it with this company and their TERRIBLE zips!! I have two jackets and they both have the worst zips that always get stuck. I have only had this jacket for a few weeks and I have had to shimmy out of it a few times just to get the zip unstuck. Come on guys, sort this issue out!! I can’t be the only one having this problem…
review.name: Nice jacket, however…

review.reviewBody: This was the first ever jacket I've bought from this company and I loved it right off the bat. It has a sleek and stylish look and serves for multiple seasons. As for water resistance, its ok at repelling water so it's worth getting the Greenland wax that they sell and add a few more coats especially over the seams to ensure before your adventures. But Overall the sten jacket is an excellent piece to have in your closet for adventures and even general use!
review.name: Great starter jacket in the Fjällräven lineup

review.reviewBody: This is a smart looking windproof jacket, but it really isn't waterproof without additional waxing. In a heavy British rainstorm in London it became completely sodden in five minutes. Even the seams of the hood let water through. Don't rely on this jacket to to protect you.
review.name: Not really waterproof

name: Sten Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Narrow Wide Cinch Direct Mount Chainring
review.reviewBody:
If you're single-ringing with a Cinch crankset, this is the chainring for you.

I've used these ranging from 30T to 36T with 10-, 11- and 12-speed drivetrains. Paired with a modern clutched rear derailleur, chain slap and chain drop should be nuisances of the past.

Relatively lightweight (it's machined from one piece of aluminum) yet somewhat spendy and prone to wear, so if price and durability are your biggest concerns, you might consider the steel version.
review.name: My Go-To Chainrings since 2016

review.itemreviewed: Narrow Wide Cinch Direct Mount Chainring
review.reviewBody: I have a 1x11 drivetrain w/ 30x42 being my lowest climbing gear.  Instead of upgrading to a 1x12 w/ 32x50, I changed my front ring to a 28t.  Everything works perfectly and the chain did not need to be shortened.  I couldn't be happier and have no desire to upgrade the drivetrain at this point.
review.name: Perfect Solution for 1x11 Drivetrain

review.itemreviewed: Narrow Wide Cinch Direct Mount Chainring
review.reviewBody: Had this sprocket for probably about 4 months, I don't ride especially hard on my bike but I somehow managed to snap this sprocket in half while climbing a hill. This ruined my $50 chain and took a chunk out of my frame not happy with this sprocket at all.
review.name: Snapped it in half

name: Narrow Wide Cinch Direct Mount Chainring

description: Buy the Lezyne Gauge Drive HP Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Gauge Drive HP Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Gauge Drive HP Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pump strikes a great balance between overall size, pump volume, and pressure.  While I agree that the plastic threads are a weak point of the design, you can reduce the chance of damage by rotating CCW until the threads click then screwing down the hose attachment.  Hitting the bleed valve releases the pressure in the hose and basically removes the chance of pulling the valve core off when removing the pump.  Pressure gauge has so far held up after 4-5 tube changes.
review.name: No More Bent Valve Stems, EVER!

review.reviewBody:
A pump... that just wouldn't pump straight out of the box. I don't have much else to say. I did some troubleshooting to the best of my ability, but no dice. What I do know is that it likely had something to do with the pen gauge. 

Since I can't stand the hassle of returns (and considering I disassembled/tinkered with every part of the pump), I guess I'm out a fifty-spot. Don't waste your time/money.
review.name: You had one job...

review.reviewBody:
Looks like a great pump but after 3 uses I am seeing the marking on the gauge starting to wear off. The black numbers showing the PSI come off very easily so be careful

Also.....the plastic threads on the end of the pump are terrible and cross thread.  Also removing the pump from the valve can sometimes result in the valve core coming out. I would not recommend this pump.
review.name: Do not buy...plastic threads that fail

name: Gauge Drive HP Pump
