review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well tailored and with ample pockets and one zippered. I use it for 45-55° over another layer. As such, I got a large though my jerseys are all medium and it worked great. The reason I don't give it five stars is that there's essentially nothing reflective on the jacket, a serious flaw for an all-black jacket.
review.name: Nice midweight jacket

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The wind stopping by the C5 is great. I am now very comfortable on rides between 45-60 degrees with appropriate layering. Pay attention to the sizing and size up to layer.
review.name: Cooler weather game changer

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for fall/spring and some mild mid-winter riding, and it does that job well.  Details like the cuffs and tail are well done, and it has a nice snug fit.  My major complaint with this jacket is the zipper.  It is a cheap plastic zipper with very fine teeth, and the teeth constantly catch the slide.  Its only a matter of time before the zipper fails and I'm left with either an expensive repair or, worse, an unusable jacket.  For the price of this jacket I would have expected better a better quality zipper.  Disappointing product quality.
review.name: Nice jacket with garbage zipper

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've hated riding in the Winter but decided to do so this past year. This jacket is perfect for temps between 40-65°F. Of course, you'll feel warm towards that upper temperature range. Our rides started in the 40's and sometimes finished around mid-60's. Unzip to help cool. I never felt sweaty from the jacket. It does a great job pulling sweat away from the back. I was always surprised to pull my phone out from the rear pocket to see how much moisture was back there.

With a great windproof base layer, I could probably ride comfortably in 30°F. The fit is perfect in a medium. In some brands I could go with a small. So I do think these run a bit small. If I put on any weight, I'd have to go to a large. I checked the sizing dimensions before purchasing and that really helped.
review.name: Perfect for Winter Riding

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought a C5 Thermo a couple weeks ago and have tested it on two decently long rides.

I wanted a windstopper jersey for dry days when my arms get cold with a thermal jersey, base layer, and gilet, for me days between 30 and 50F.  I find in those conditions a full length nylon coat just doesn't breathe well enough, and a full soft shell jacket is just too bulky.  I don't ride in the wet much and don't ride below 30F.  With this jersey and the proper base layer, no gilet or arm warmers are necessary.

I would consider this a late fall, winter, and early spring jersey, not a jacket.  It's got rear storage pockets like a jersey and it's not really waterproof though would probably be ok in a light rain.

I considered the Castelli Perfetto ROS long sleeve, this jersey's main competition. They both are around the same price and both use the Gore Infinium fabric which is a breathable windstopper.  I tried on both the Castelli and the Gore.  

I believe the Castelli would breathe better due to a more breathable fabric on the back of the jersey.  It is definitely lighter in total weight and stretchier than the C5.  In those ways I thought maybe it was superior to the Gore.

I prefer the pockets on the Gore, I like the 2 larger rear rather than the 3 smaller on the Castelli for accessing in cold weather with gloves on.  The small zippered security pocket for keys and credit card on the Gore was a major thing for me, have to have that. Castelli does not have a zippered pocket and thus a deal breaker - too easy to lose a credit card when pulling layers or food out of a rear pocket.

Fitwise, the Perfetto, as it is a Castelli, was way too tight for my 5'9" 180 pound build. Would have had to go up to XL or even 2XL to be large enough to layer under and sleeves and waist length would be WAY too long in those sizes.

Fit on the Large Gore C5 was excellent for me.  As a few other reviewers have noted, though, the sleeves are puzzlingly baggy. Everywhere else it is right on for a non super skinny Italian bike racer, normal sort of guy fit.  I can wear nothing to a heavy weight base layer under it.

The biggest criticism I have is I felt the jersey could breathe better. At 50F on a 100 mile day with some climbing I got a bit clammy and the jersey was a bit damp inside when I finished the ride.  Even at lower temps I believe this would also happen due to the lack of breathability on the back of the jersey.

Temperature range is always subjective depending on the individual, but for me 50 with a summer weight base layer was the warmest I could use this jersey.  It could easily go below freezing with the proper weight base layer, and it seems to me that below 45 is where it would really excel.

I ended up buying this jersey for the fit and zippered pocket. If the Castelli fits you and you can do without the zippered pocket, it may be a better option.

The C5 is a great jersey but not perfect.
review.name: Gore C5 Infinium Thermo Jacket
comment: You reviewing a jacket or jersey?  This is the Jacket page, and title of review says Jacket, but throughout you refer to "jersey".  Great review, just trying to figure out what product you're actually reviewing.

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This jacket fits very tightly and I am very glad I sized up from a small to a medium.  I generally wear small shirts and jackets unless they are cut like this jacket.  With a Castelli base layer there is not much room to add another layer but that shouldn't matter!  It mainly tight around my torso.  The sleeves aren't restrictive at all and sizing up hasn't made the sleeves too long for me.

This thing is definitely warm and windproof.  On a cloudy/windy 37 degree day I was toasty and almost hot when riding aggressively or climbing.  Riding downhill the jacket doesn't let a lick of wind through.  I didn't get a chill which suggests its breathing well during the higher body temp climbs.  So far it seems great and I am feeling stoked about it.  Great first impression.
review.name: First Impressions and Sizing
comment: Is the size M that you bought based on US or EU sizing?

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Was super excited to receive the jacket which has been intermittently sold out in the orange color and size large. I was happy to see there was 1 in stock. Today I received it. Tags were already cut from the product and two black stains already on the jacket. Besides nasty black stains during covid times, this jacket is perfect. This jacket must have been a return. Noticeably been touched by someone else. It's a bike product I get it but still gross.
review.name: Perfect jacket; stains

review.itemreviewed: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Athletic body, I'm not skinny, I go to the gym 3 times a week. Wore this jacket over my jersey and it fit perfectly. I purchased a large gore jersey and also purchase a large gore jacket and they both worked out with each other. The quality, the look, and very comfy while riding. Kept my body warm during 39 degree weather. Purchased in black and it looks great. Gore makes quality stuff, would recommend
review.name: Really Great Jacket

name: C5 GORE-TEX INFINIUM Thermo Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Georgia High Waist Bikini Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: The print is cute but the fit is weird, think bathing suit bottom + granny panties.
review.name: Not flattering...

review.itemreviewed: Georgia High Waist Bikini Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Love these swim bottoms! On me, the fit is modest with a true low cut leg, high rise (fits above my naval), and full bottom coverage (thankfully not cheeky at all). The texture and weight of the fabric adds a luxe feel. Construction including the zipper is sturdy- this suit definitely seems durable. The cut and faux pocket detail give it a subtle vintage style but it still looks modern.

This is the first swim bottom I've found that I feel comfortable in and can easily move in without covering up with shorts. Definitely recommend for anyone looking for more coverage.
review.name: Fully covered, comfortable, well-made

review.itemreviewed: Georgia High Waist Bikini Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: These were very high quality, but may run slightly big (or should I say true to size for a women?s size, which is hard to find these days). I was worried that once they stretched in the water, they would sag in the back and around the leg openings. I am 5?7 and 135 pounds and purchased the medium because my trouble area is in my waist. review.reviewBody: I bought the Stretchdown Light Jacket in Hardwear Navy. I'm 6' tall and 180lb. Jacket is a perfect fit and I love how thin and light the jacket is given its 700 fill rating.
review.name: Enjoy the jacket for its fit and feel

review.reviewBody: Love these, I have 2 of them & bought this one for my boyfriend. He also loved the stretchiness and style. He’s 6’2”, 190 & the Medium fit well.
review.name: Best down coat

review.reviewBody: Great product! Lightweight & very comfortable. Plus like the color!
review.name: Mtn Hardwear Stretchdown Jkt

review.reviewBody:
Another great product! I had ordered this after misplacing the hooded, half-zip version. After having the half zip, I did find that I wanted a full-zip, and this presented the right opportunity. One thing I had worried about was the interior storage capacity, finding that I often utilized the internal kangaroo pouch. It was a great relief to find it still there, but split in two, which worked better for my use-case. 
Another go-to jacket!
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket.. super high quality feel and finish
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, warm and comfortable - this jacket is awesome!
review.name: Best jacket I own

review.reviewBody: Love it! Only wish is that there was a hooded version!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
I get too hot too fast, and this lightweight down jacket is just the right weight to keep me warm without overheating.

I'm 6'4", 225 lbs, with very long arms. The large fits my chest and gut great, but there isn't much room to layer under this. Mountain Hardware is the only brand that comes close to fitting my arm length, but I wish they were 1/2” longer (but then they would only fit us freaks!). Normally proportioned people will be very happy!

Some people don't like that it's missing a chest pocket, but there is actually a "flap" created on the inside by the way the hand pockets are constructed. I use this just like a chest pocket.

I don't miss the waste draw cord, but I wish it had a hood.
review.name: Third MH down jacket, will continue buying!

review.reviewBody: Great fit & style, and very warm functional insulated layer!
review.name: Buy this jacket!

review.reviewBody: So far so good! I definitely like that this jacket can be dressed up and feels like a technical puffy. Warm and functional and looks good! It does fit a little bigger than I thought but not too bad. Offers room for a sweater or layering under it. I wish the collar would stand up better. Overall I love having a casual jacket like this that can be dressed up or down but still offers some of the great features of a technical down jacket.
review.name: Got you covered on the mountain or downtown

name: Stretchdown Light Shacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: The balance of staying warm but not overheating when moving/on the uphill can be tough, but with the Nano Air Light Vest in your closet it is easier. I use this vest all year round in combination with other Patagonia technical layers to stay comfortable. It is great for keeping your core warm while hiking, ski touring, cross country skiiing, cycling, or winter running without getting too hot. It regulates temperature very well by being so breathable yet warm for its weight. It is a slim fit to layer easily and is lighter/has less insulation than the Nano Air Vest. I love mine and highly recommend it. I’m Backcountry’s Patagonia ambassador and expert, so if you have any questions, feel free to reach out on chat M-F, 801-204-4562 or amcclary@backcountry.com
review.name: Temperature Regulator!

review.reviewBody:
I REALLY wanted to love this vest.  I have been loving and enjoying Patagonia products for years...mostly.  And, this vest is just wrong in so many ways.  I ordered a size up from what I usually get in Patagonia products given some of the reviews I had read about this particular vest.  I am also built like the women modeling the vest.  So, I honestly thought, "This might work."  The vest is absolutely too big around my torso, and though I am not particularly "hippy," when zipped, the vest feels too tight at the bottom.  I will not be buying a smaller size, and would not recommend this product.  And, I agree, what a bummer to have to pay to return it.

About ten years ago (I know, eons ago for fashion) I bought two Patagonia puffy jackets and a vest that fit me perfectly.  Rather than falling below my waist, these pieces ended right at my waist, and they don't bunch up when I bend over.  The jackets and vest also fit my female shape.  I am not a young, athletic man, and am not built like a straight up-and-down toothpick.  I was hoping that this Nano Air vest would replace my earlier vest.  And, I should have known better.  Sadly, it seems that Patagonia is making things for women longer and more narrow.  I am still a fan of Patagonia's, but loyalty is waning.
review.name: So disappointing

review.reviewBody:
Only paying for the name, paper thin, tighter than normal I have several Patagonia vest, recommend sizing up if u are wearing something under.

For the kicker came with a huge snag,  now I have to pay to mail back.  Definitely rethinking this company in future.
review.name: Overall very bad

review.reviewBody: This vest is a poor effort on Patagonia's part.  We have loved their nano puffy vests and coats for years.  This is not up to that standard.  It is pretty worthless.  Don't buy.  We are sending it back immediately after opening.  Bummer to have to pay Backcountry to send it back.
review.name: bad product

description: Buy the Backcountry Access Scepter 4S Adjustable Ski Pole online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Scepter 4S Adjustable Ski Pole
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Access Scepter 4S Adjustable Ski Pole online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Scepter 4S Adjustable Ski Pole with high hopes at the start of this ski season, attracted by its adjustable feature which promised versatility across different skiing conditions. Unfortunately, my experience fell far short of expectations due to a critical flaw in its design and durability.

After using the ski poles no more than five times, I encountered a significant issue with the locking mechanism—a vital component that ensures the pole remains extended to the desired length. The metallic nub, which plays a crucial role in locking the pole in place, dislodged and fell into the interior shaft of the pole. This malfunction not only rendered the ski pole unusable but also raised concerns about the overall quality and reliability of the product.

The concept of an adjustable ski pole is indeed appealing, offering adaptability for varying terrains and personal preferences. However, the execution, in this case, is deeply flawed. A ski pole's integrity and reliability are paramount, especially when navigating through challenging ski conditions. The failure of such a fundamental feature not only undermines the product's value but also poses potential safety risks to its users.

I reached out to customer service in hopes of a resolution, emphasizing the premature nature of the product's failure and its limited use. While the outcome of this interaction is pending, this experience has significantly impacted my confidence in the brand and its products.

For fellow skiers considering the Scepter 4S Adjustable Ski Pole, I would urge caution and perhaps look towards more reliable alternatives. The concept might be promising, but the durability and execution leave much to be desired. A ski pole should be a dependable piece of equipment, not a source of frustration and potential hazard on the slopes.

While I had hoped the Scepter 4S Adjustable Ski Pole would be a versatile and valuable addition to my skiing gear, the reality was a disappointing testament to its poor durability and design. I hope this review helps others make more informed decisions and encourages the manufacturer to address these critical issues.
review.name: Disappointing Durability: A Review of th

review.reviewBody: These poles seemed really promising - adjustable, lightweight yet sturdy, and I loved the idea of having a scraper on the handle. Only trouble is - for some reason these poles are super tall. I have always had 110cm poles since I'm 5'3'' - but these were still comically too tall for me on the shortest setting. My husband is 5'7" and they were even too tall for him. Just FYI if you're short! I had to return sadly :(
review.name: Very tall!

review.reviewBody: I bought this sweater and one other Dale of Norway sweater, both size Large, at the same time.  I'm a fairly tall guy of medium build with a normal BMI. I wear a size 42 inch suit. The Dale of Norway size chart here indicates that size Large is appropriate for Chest 41in, so I chose Large knowing that some sweaters do run big.  I received the sweater and tried it on, and it is far too big and bulky, especially as noted by one other reviewer in the underarms where multiple seams meet (see photo).  It is not tailored for a normal V-shaped body frame at all either. The wool itself is uncomfortable and itchy/scratchy, unlike the other Dale of Norway sweater I bought and love!  I am not sure I'd want to be celebrating my 140th Anniversary with such an uncomfortable garment.  I am very disappointed in this sweater and will be returning it.
review.name: Bulky under the arms, scratchy wool

name: 140th Anniversary Sweater - Men's
